         Thailand
        </a>
        blocked access between 2006 and 2007 due to offensive videos relating to King
        <a href="/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">
         Bhumibol Adulyadej
        </a>
        .
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-387">
         <a href="#cite_note-387">
          [387]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-388">
         <a href="#cite_note-388">
          [388]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Some Australian state education departments block YouTube citing "an inability to determine what sort of video material might be accessed" and "There's no educational value to it and the content of the material on the site."
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-389">
         <a href="#cite_note-389">
          [389]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        China blocked access from October 15, 2007 to March 22, 2008, and again starting on March 24, 2009. Access remains blocked.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-390">
         <a href="#cite_note-390">
          [390]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-391">
         <a href="#cite_note-391">
          [391]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-392">
         <a href="#cite_note-392">
          [392]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-393">
         <a href="#cite_note-393">
          [393]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Morocco blocked access in May 2007, possibly as a result of videos critical of Morocco's actions in Western Sahara.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-394">
         <a href="#cite_note-394">
          [394]
         </a>
        </sup>
        YouTube became accessible again on May 30, 2007, after
        <i>
         Maroc Telecom
        </i>
        unofficially announced that the denied access to the website was a mere "technical glitch".
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-395">
         <a href="#cite_note-395">
          [395]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Turkey blocked access between 2008 and 2010 after controversy over videos deemed insulting to
        <a href="/wiki/Mustafa_Kemal_Atat%C3%BCrk" title="Mustafa Kemal Atatürk">
         Mustafa Kemal Atatürk
        </a>
        .
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-396">
         <a href="#cite_note-396">
          [396]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-bbc_turkey_397-0">
         <a href="#cite_note-bbc_turkey-397">
          [397]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-398">
         <a href="#cite_note-398">
          [398]
         </a>
        </sup>
        In November 2010, a video of the Turkish politician
        <a href="/wiki/Deniz_Baykal" title="Deniz Baykal">
         Deniz Baykal
        </a>
        caused the site to be blocked again briefly, and the site was threatened with a new shutdown if it did not remove the video.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-399">
         <a href="#cite_note-399">
          [399]
         </a>
        </sup>
        During the two and a half-year block of YouTube, the video-sharing website remained the eighth-most-accessed site in Turkey.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-400">
         <a href="#cite_note-400">
          [400]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-401">
         <a href="#cite_note-401">
          [401]
         </a>
        </sup>
        In 2014, Turkey blocked the access for the second time, after "a high-level intelligence leak."
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-402">
         <a href="#cite_note-402">
          [402]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-403">
         <a href="#cite_note-403">
          [403]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-404">
         <a href="#cite_note-404">
          [404]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Pakistan blocked access on February 23, 2008, because of "offensive material" towards the Islamic faith, including display of the
        <a href="/wiki/Jyllands-Posten_Muhammad_cartoons_controversy" title="Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons controversy">
         Danish cartoons
        </a>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Muhammad" title="Muhammad">
         Muhammad
        </a>
        .
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-405">
         <a href="#cite_note-405">
          [405]
         </a>
        </sup>
        This led to a near global blackout of the YouTube site for around two hours, as the Pakistani block was inadvertently transferred to other countries. On February 26, 2008, the ban was lifted after the website had removed the objectionable content from its servers at the request of the government.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PAK-ban-lifted_406-0">
         <a href="#cite_note-PAK-ban-lifted-406">
          [406]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-407">
         <a href="#cite_note-407">
          [407]
         </a>
        </sup>
        Many Pakistanis circumvented the three-day block by using
        <a href="/wiki/Virtual_private_network" title="Virtual private network">
         virtual private network
        </a>
        software.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-408">
         <a href="#cite_note-408">
          [408]
         </a>
        </sup>
        In May 2010, following the
        <a href="/wiki/Everybody_Draw_Mohammed_Day" title="Everybody Draw Mohammed Day">
         Everybody Draw Mohammed Day
        </a>
        , Pakistan again blocked access to YouTube, citing "growing sacrilegious content".
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-409">
         <a href="#cite_note-409">
          [409]
         </a>
        </sup>
        The ban was lifted on May 27, 2010, after the website removed the objectionable content from its servers at the request of the government. However, individual videos deemed offensive to Muslims posted on YouTube will continue to be blocked.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-410">
         <a href="#cite_note-410">
          [410]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-411">
         <a href="#cite_note-411">
          [411]
         </a>
        </sup>
        Pakistan again placed a ban on YouTube in September 2012, after the site refused to remove the film
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Innocence_of_Muslims" title="Innocence of Muslims">
          Innocence of Muslims
         </a>
        </i>
        , with the ban still in operation as of September 2013.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-412">
         <a href="#cite_note-412">
          [412]
         </a>
        </sup>
        The ban was lifted in January 2016 after YouTube launched a Pakistan-specific version.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-413">
         <a href="#cite_note-413">
          [413]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Turkmenistan" title="Turkmenistan">
         Turkmenistan
        </a>
        blocked access on December 25, 2009, for unknown reasons. Other websites, such as
        <a href="/wiki/LiveJournal" title="LiveJournal">
         LiveJournal
        </a>
        were also blocked.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-414">
         <a href="#cite_note-414">
          [414]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Libya blocked access on January 24, 2010, because of videos that featured demonstrations in the city of
        <a href="/wiki/Benghazi" title="Benghazi">
         Benghazi
        </a>
        by families of detainees who were killed in
        <a href="/wiki/Abu_Salim_prison" title="Abu Salim prison">
         Abu Salim prison
        </a>
        in 1996, and videos of family members of Libyan leader
        <a href="/wiki/Muammar_Gaddafi" title="Muammar Gaddafi">
         Muammar Gaddafi
        </a>
        at parties. The blocking was criticized by
        <a href="/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch" title="Human Rights Watch">
         Human Rights Watch
        </a>
        .
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-415">
         <a href="#cite_note-415">
          [415]
         </a>
        </sup>
        In November 2011, after the
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/2011_Libyan_Civil_War" title="2011 Libyan Civil War">
         Libyan Civil War
        </a>
        , YouTube was once again allowed in Libya.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-416">
         <a href="#cite_note-416">
          [416]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Afghanistan" title="Afghanistan">
         Afghanistan
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Bangladesh" title="Bangladesh">
         Bangladesh
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Russia" title="Russia">
         Russia
        </a>
        , and
        <a href="/wiki/Sudan" title="Sudan">
         Sudan
        </a>
        blocked access in September 2012 following controversy over a 14-minute trailer for the film
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Innocence_of_Muslims" title="Innocence of Muslims">
          Innocence of Muslims
         </a>
        </i>
        which had been posted on the site.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-417">
         <a href="#cite_note-417">
          [417]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-418">
         <a href="#cite_note-418">
          [418]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-419">
         <a href="#cite_note-419">
          [419]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-420">
         <a href="#cite_note-420">
          [420]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-421">
         <a href="#cite_note-421">
          [421]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-422">
         <a href="#cite_note-422">
          [422]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        In Libya and
        <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">
         Egypt
        </a>
        , the
        <i>
         Innocence of Muslims
        </i>
        trailer was blamed
        <sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">
         [
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Unsupported_attributions" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Words to watch">
           <span title="The material near this tag may use weasel words or too-vague attribution. (September 2017)">
            by whom?
           </span>
          </a>
         </i>
         ]
        </sup>
        for
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/2012_diplomatic_missions_attacks" title="2012 diplomatic missions attacks">
         violent protests
        </a>
        in September 2012. YouTube stated that "This video—which is widely available on the Web—is clearly within our guidelines and so will stay on YouTube. However, given the very difficult situation in Libya and Egypt we have temporarily restricted access in both countries."
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-423">
         <a href="#cite_note-423">
          [423]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-424">
         <a href="#cite_note-424">
          [424]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">
        See also
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="infobox sisterproject plainlinks haudio" id="section_SpokenWikipedia">
       <div style="text-align: center; white-space:nowrap">
        <b>
         Listen to this article
        </b>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/File:Youtube_spoken_word.ogg" title="File:Youtube spoken word.ogg">
         info/dl
        </a>
        )
        <div class="center">
         <div class="floatnone">
          <div class="mediaContainer" style="width:200px">
           <audio class="kskin" controls="" data-durationhint="1752.9910657596" data-mwprovider="wikimediacommons" data-mwtitle="Youtube_spoken_word.ogg" data-startoffset="0" id="mwe_player_0" preload="none" style="width:200px">

        " dated 2011-03-26, and does not reflect subsequent edits to the article. (
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Media_help" title="Wikipedia:Media help">

      <div aria-label="Portals" class="noprint portal plainlist tright" role="navigation" style="margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em;border:solid #aaa 1px">
       <ul style="display:table;box-sizing:border-box;padding:0.1em;max-width:175px;background:#f9f9f9;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold">
        <li style="display:table-row">
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center">
          <img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="48" data-file-width="48" height="28" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/Abc.xyz_Favicon.png/28px-Abc.xyz_Favicon.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/Abc.xyz_Favicon.png/42px-Abc.xyz_Favicon.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/11/Abc.xyz_Favicon.png 2x" width="28"/>
         </span>
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle">
          <a href="/wiki/Portal:Alphabet" title="Portal:Alphabet">
           Alphabet portal
          </a>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li style="display:table-row">
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center">
          <img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="512" data-file-width="512" height="28" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Industry5.svg/28px-Industry5.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Industry5.svg/42px-Industry5.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Industry5.svg/56px-Industry5.svg.png 2x" width="28"/>
         </span>
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle">
          <a href="/wiki/Portal:Companies" title="Portal:Companies">
           Companies portal
          </a>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li style="display:table-row">
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center">
          <img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="92" data-file-width="272" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Google_2015_logo.svg/32px-Google_2015_logo.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Google_2015_logo.svg/48px-Google_2015_logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Google_2015_logo.svg/64px-Google_2015_logo.svg.png 2x" width="32"/>
         </span>
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle">
          <a href="/wiki/Portal:Google" title="Portal:Google">
           Google portal
          </a>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li style="display:table-row">
         <span style="display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Crystal_Clear_app_linneighborhood.svg">

          </a>
         </span>

          </a>

         <span class="reference-text">

         </span>
        </li>

          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Official+YouTube+Blog&amp;rft.atitle=True+colors%3A+adding+support+for+HDR+videos+on+YouTube&amp;rft.date=2016-11-07&amp;rft.aulast=Robertson&amp;rft.aufirst=Steven&amp;rft.au=Verma%2C+Sanjeev&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.googleblog.com%2F2016%2F11%2Ftrue-colors-adding-support-for-hdr.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AYouTube">
           <span style="display:none;">

          </span>
         </span>

        <li id="cite_note-106">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-106">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           <a class="external text" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ANcspdYh_U" rel="nofollow">
            "YouTube in 3D"
           </a>
           . YouTube. July 21, 2009
           <span class="reference-accessdate">

            <span class="nowrap">

            </span>

          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=YouTube+in+3D&amp;rft.pub=YouTube&amp;rft.date=2009-07-21&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D5ANcspdYh_U&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AYouTube">

           <a class="external text" href="https://www.webcitation.org/6MSsLaMuk?url=http://www.psmag.com/navigation/politics-and-law/the-cascading-effects-of-the-arab-spring-28575/" rel="nofollow">

           </a>

          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Daily+Beast&amp;rft.atitle=A+YouTube+Star%2C+Reddit+Detectives%2C+and+the+Alt-Right+Call+Out+a+Fake+News+Story.+Turns+Out+It+Was+Real.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Farticles%2F2017%2F04%2F04%2Ffake-news-blows-up-in-trolls-faces.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AYouTube">

          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-verge_350-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation news">
           Popper, Ben (November 9, 2017).
           <a class="external text" href="https://www.theverge.com/2017/11/9/16629788/youtube-kids-distrubing-inappropriate-flag-age-restrict" rel="nofollow">
            "YouTube says it will crack down on bizarre videos targeting children"
           </a>
           .
           <i>
            <a href="/wiki/The_Verge" title="The Verge">
             The Verge
            </a>
           </i>
           .
           <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20171116090955/https://www.theverge.com/2017/11/9/16629788/youtube-kids-distrubing-inappropriate-flag-age-restrict" rel="nofollow">
            Archived
           </a>
           from the original on November 16, 2017.
           <q>
            In August of this year, YouTube announced that it would no longer allow creators to monetize videos which "made inappropriate use of family friendly characters." Today it's taking another step to try and police this genre.
           </q>
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Verge&amp;rft.atitle=YouTube+says+it+will+crack+down+on+bizarre+videos+targeting+children&amp;rft.date=2017-11-09&amp;rft.aulast=Popper&amp;rft.aufirst=Ben&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theverge.com%2F2017%2F11%2F9%2F16629788%2Fyoutube-kids-distrubing-inappropriate-flag-age-restrict&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AYouTube">
           <span style="display:none;">
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>

        <li id="cite_note-guardian_migrate-374">
         <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
          <b>
           <a href="#cite_ref-guardian_migrate_374-0">
            ^
           </a>
          </b>
         </span>
         <span class="reference-text">
          <cite class="citation web">
           <a class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2012/dec/28/youtube-video-views-disappear-migrate" rel="nofollow">

           </a>
           . The Guardian. December 28, 2012

            </span>

           .
          </cite>
          <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Two+billion+YouTube+music+video+views+disappear+%E2%80%A6+or+just+migrate%3F&amp;rft.pub=The+Guardian&amp;rft.date=2012-12-28&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Ftechnology%2F2012%2Fdec%2F28%2Fyoutube-video-views-disappear-migrate&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AYouTube">

           </span>
           .
          </cite>

          Kelsey, Todd (2010).

           <i>

          </a>
          . Springer-Verlag.
          <a href="/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number" title="International Standard Book Number">

          . Richmond: Crimson.

        <li style="min-height: 31px;">
         <span style="display: inline-block; width: 31px; line-height: 31px; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">
